intro: Tribrachya morindiformis, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
